Music Reviews

Lonely The Brave: "I don't think you can be a British musician and not want to play Glastonbury"

Amongst the deserted poles and seedy images of Fibbers' upstairs strip club, Lonely The Brave sit down with Ellie Langford

Album Review: Modest Mouse - Strangers to Ourselves

Occasionally frustrating and with a tendency to drag in places, Strangers to Ourselves still has some excellent moments. Jonathon Hoare reviews

Album Review: Darlia - Petals

Darlia are the fresh faces of classic British rock. Ellie Langford reviews

Album Review: Imagine Dragons - Smoke + Mirrors

The foursome return with a follow-up worthy of the credentials afforded by their debut, says Shahreen Vacha

Live Review: Livestock with Jack McNeill and Donkey Zoo

"On 13 February I spent four hours in Fibbers rocking out to the sound of Benjamin Turner's dissertation..."

Album Review: Enter Shikari - The Mindsweep

Ellie Langford takes the hardcore rock group's latest record for a spin

Album Review: Bob Dylan - Shadows in the Night

Alex Killeen comments on what he considers "an essential listen for the sound of 2015"

Album Review: Drake - If You're Reading This It's Too Late

Shahreen Vacha reviews the surprise release from the increasingly prolific rapper

Live Review: Peace @ Brudenell Social Club, Leeds

Their fan base is fervent and they know their way around a tight, catchy, pop song

Album Review: BADBADNOTGOOD & Ghostface Killah - Sour Soul

A left field collaboration is pulled off with experimental flair, says Aaron Stennett

Live Review: Luxo Jr and Frontier Ruckus @ The Basement, York

The newly re-vamped venue plays host to a night of deft musicianship and eclectic styles

Album Review: Lupe Fiasco - Tetsuo & Youth

Lupe Fiasco assembles a multi-faceted work of art for his fifth studio album.

Album Review: Peace - Happy People

Peace reveal a newfound maturity and dynamisn on their new album. Lily Papworth reviews

Album Review: Marilyn Manson - The Pale Emperor

Manson goes for evolution over revolution on his ninth studio effort and pulls it off with more than a little flair, says Lara Shannon

Live Review: Elliot Galvin Trio @ Jack Lyons Concert Hall, York

The 'improvisation jazz' trio are so much greater than the sum of their parts, says Jack Harvey

Live Review: Freakin presents Daniel Avery @ Mansion

Freakin keep delivering the goods as Daniel Avery makes a momentous return to York. Rachel Thompson reviews

Live Review: Rae Morris @ The Wardrobe, Leeds

Hatti Linnell reviews as the female solo artist of the moment brings her debut album tour to Leeds

The Ting Tings: "I wouldn't expect a polished live show. It's not us"

"We've gotten to our third album by not selling ourselves out." The Ting Tings have a chat with Jack Elliott

Live Review: Laura Marling @ The Trades Club, Hebden Bridge

'Minutes seem like seconds as Marling brings melody, language and rhythm to glorious, delicate life before our ears'

Live Review: Vanbrugh Jazz Night's 2nd Birthday

Jack Harvey introduces us to the college's vibrant weekly jazz spot

Album Review: Pond - Man It Feels Like Space Again

A bonafide chic effort that will tap in nicely to the increasing demand for euphoric psychadelia

Album Review: The Decemberists - What a Terrible World, What a Beautiful World

Lara Shannon examines the evolving musical style of the American indie-rock five-piece and how it plays out on their latest offering

Album Review: AC/DC - Rock or Bust

The Australian hard rock outfit maintain their high standard, says Ben Phillips

Album Review: Rae Morris - Unguarded

'Unguarded is a walk in a manicured garden, not the trek through the wilderness that it promises to be'

Album Review: Mark Ronson - Uptown Special

Lewis Hill takes Ronson's first solo offering in five years for a spin

Live Review: Drenge @ Brudenell Social Club, Leeds

Those looking for a cathartic slice of heavy rock will not be disappointed.

Live Review: Animaux presents Palace

Arun Kakar gives his verdict on the latest Mansion techno night

Album Review: The Smashing Pumpkins - Monuments to an Elegy

Does Billy Corgan have what it takes to produce another classic like Siamese Dream?

Album Review: Nicki Minaj - The Pinkprint

New queen of hip-hop returns for album number 3.

Live Review: Coasts

Emily McDonnell heads to the band's Leeds Brudenell Social Club gig to find out what all the fuss is about
